title: Adding Imaging Time Series Algorithms
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
sktime currently has a function "plot_series" for plotting time series. I am thinking of introducing Imaging of time series in "plot_series", which is transforming time series into images, a popular transformation. Imaging algorithms are "recurrence plot", "Gramian Angular Summation Field", "Gramian Angular Difference Field", and "Markov Transition Field". One important upside of this transformation is retrieving information for any pair of time points (x_i, x_j) given a time series (x_1, . . . , x_n). 

**Describe the solution you'd like**

plot_series(series, labels=None, markers=None, imaging_method=None): 
-> This will plot one or more time series, that is plot_series default task

plot_series(series, labels=None, markers=None, imaging_method = "recurrence_plot") 
-> This will give recurrence plot

This will ensure that the existing codebase wouldn't get hampered as we are introducing a default parameter.
